definition: interchanging the positions of the king and a rook, to move the king two squares toward a rook and in the same move the rook to the square next past the king
details:
noun
- interchanging the positions of the king and a rook
= synonyms: castling
- a large building formerly occupied by a ruler and fortified against attack
- the piece in chess that can move any number of unoccupied squares in a direction parallel to the sides of the chessboard
= example: the piece in chess that can move any number of unoccupied squares in a direction parallel to the sides of the chessboard
= synonyms: rook
- a large and stately mansion
= synonyms: palace
verb
- to move the king two squares toward a rook and in the same move the rook to the square next past the king
